key_risks: Regulatory and compliance risks due to stringent oversight and potential penalties
Economic and market risks from interest rate fluctuations and overexposure to commercial real estate loans
Cybersecurity risks following a significant data breach affecting customer data
Competitive pressures from larger banks, credit unions, and fintech disruptors
controversies: Data breach at Valley National Bank affecting 873,000 customers
Potential regulatory scrutiny and enforcement actions similar to peer firms
social_issues: Data breach compromising sensitive customer information, leading to potential loss of trust
governance_issues: Regulatory compliance challenges and potential enforcement actions
Cybersecurity governance concerns following the data breach

sources.title: List of bank failures in the United States (2008-present)
sources.snippet: On average, between 1980 and 1994, a US bank failed every three days. The pace of bankruptcies peaked immediately after the 2008 financial crisis. [1] The 2007-2008 financial crisis led to many bank failures in the United States. The Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (FDIC) closed 465 failed banks from 2008 to 2012. [2] In contrast, in the five years prior to 2008, only 10 banks failed.
